Description: Silver round patera (?) broken into several fragments reunited, with a small flat base and a cylindrical rim with a spout in the shape of a truncated triangle. No evidence of a handle, but it might have been fixed on one of the missing parts of the rim.
Bibliographic references: Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.42, p.52, p.173, pl.15)
